tool.name: BabelConvert
tool.description: : This class is a wrapper of the Open Babel tool.

param.name: input_path
param.label: input DAT,ENT,FA,FASTA,GRO,INP,LOG,MCIF,MDL,MMCIF,MOL,MOL2,PDB,PDBQT,PNG,SDF,SMI,SMILES,TXT,XML,XTC file
param.help: Path to the input file. Format: [input].[format]

param.name: outname_output_path
param.label: output ENT,FA,FASTA,GRO,INP,MCIF,MDL,MMCIF,MOL,MOL2,PDB,PDBQT,PNG,SDF,SMI,SMILES,TXT name
param.help: Path to the output file Format: [output].[format]

param.name: sele
param.label: Take tool settings:
param.help: Select where tool settings are to be read from
param.option: Manual Input
from configuration file
from JSON string

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: input_format
param.label: input_format
param.help: Format of input file. If not provided, input_path extension will be taken.
param.option: dat - Information represented in a data record
ent - Protein Data Bank format
fa - FASTA sequence format
fasta - FASTA sequence format
gro - GROMACS structure
inp - AMBER trajectory format
log - Events file
mcif - Entry format of PDB database in mmCIF format
mdl - file format for holding information about the atoms; bonds; connectivity and coordinates of a molecule
mmcif - Entry format of PDB database in mmCIF format
mol - file format for holding information about the atoms; bonds; connectivity and coordinates of a molecule
mol2 - Complete and portable representation of a SYBYL molecule
pdb - Protein Data Bank format
pdbqt - Protein Data Bank format with charges
png - File format for image compression
sdf - One of a family of chemical-data file formats developed by MDL Information Systems
smi - Chemical structure specified in Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System line notation.
smiles - Chemical structure specified in Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System line notation.
txt - Textual format
xml - eXtensible Markup Language
xtc - Portable binary format for trajectories produced by GROMACS package
